intro: Psychotria glandulosa, commonly known as the "glandular psychotria," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with prominent glandular dots. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
